result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Loren Worley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The court orders that the defendant is to obtain a Bachelor's Degree.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term and if the defendant obtains a Bachelor's Degree, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Defendant comply with any terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 2:00 p.m. Defendant Brandon Loren Worley in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by DA Blader.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Count 1 to Misd Poss of THC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e).   Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14TR1693 - NC. 14TR1884 - Dismissed outright. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Defendant must obtain a bachelor's degree, complete any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Upon successful completion of probation and if the defendant obtains a bachelor's degree the court will allow the defendant to petition for expungment. Appeal rights given. 

14TR1693: Court orders: $761.50 plus blood draw fees in the amount of $42.50 w/ 60 DTP or PP, 6 month DL revocation, OWI Assessment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Brandon Loren Worley in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a P/S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Loren Worley
Current: 586 Sourth St, Apt 5, Green Lake, WI 54941-9441 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2014)
Prior: 459 Scott Street, Green Lake, WI 54941
Status conference on October 28, 2014 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:35 AM: Defendant Brandon Loren Worley in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of 20 days time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  SPD argues as to amendment to bond conditions on no driving prohibition.  Def has now moved to Sauk City.  Argument by DA as to bond conditions.  Believes any operation should be very limited.  The Court:  Based upon allegations as they exist, Court respectfully declines any bond modification at this time.  May be revisited in the future.  STC scheduled, P/S more than likely will be requested prior to the next STC date.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on September 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle. No unexcused absences or tardys at school. Defendant is to be present at the home of one of the parents unless working at the McDonald's in Ripon.

1:29 pm case called. Defendant Brandon Loren Worley in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Brandon Loren Worley in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. INIT scheduled/NOH given.   Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.
